results.title: Beyond the frame (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Royal College of Art (Great Britain), Tate Gallery and B.Z. Vincent-Batyka
results.brief_description: In attempting to break down the barriers between art galleries and the general public, the Tate Gallery gives lectures to groups of adults and is involved in a special program for children, called Kid’s Play, to help them appreciate the different types and forms of art.

results.title: Beyond the edge: professionals at play
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Big Fish Down Under”.
An adventurous journey to the Coral Sea and to a remote, detached reef, called Holmes, beyond the edge of the Great Barrier Reef. It is a fishing and diving trip which includes exploring water 1,000 fathoms deep and investigating the decaying wreck of a Japanese longliner. Written and presented by Malcolm Florence.

results.title: Beyond the dune
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Wild Australia”.
Depicts birdlife on the salt lagoons of the Coorong, S.A., including banded stilts, cormorants and dotterels. Includes a longer study of the colony of pelicans on Pelican Island, especially the play behaviour and feeding of fledglings. John Olsen’s paintings are featured also in this documentary. Suitable for upper primary and secondary levels.

results.title: Beyond the clouds = Par-dela les nuages
results.creator_credit: Sunshine, Cine B, France 3 Cinema, Road Movies Zweite Produktionen, Cecchi Gori Group, Philippe Carcassonne, Stephen Tchal Gadjieff and Michelangelo Antonioni
results.brief_description: This was Antonioni’s return to filmmaking after suffering a stroke in 1985. He presents 4 vignettes linked thematically by notions of desire, as well as a fictional director in search of a story (portrayed by John Malkovich). In the first story two beautiful lovers, Silvano and Carmen (Kim Rossi Stuart and Ines Sastre) are unable to consummate their love because of his pursuit of perfection. In the second story John Malkovich’s character meets a woman (Sophie Marceau) who confesses to killing her father. The third story involves a man (Peter Weller) who must decide between his wife (Fanny Ardant) and his lover (Chiara Caselli). In the final story a man (Vincent Perez) becomes obsessed with a woman (Irene Jacob) who is “satisfied” with life and is about to enter a convent. Screen legends Jeanne Moreau and Marcello Mastroianni make a brief appearance and have an overall involvement to the story rather than being directly involved with any of the vignettes. In French, Italian and English with English subtitles. Co-directed by Wim Wenders.

results.title: Beyond the border crossing
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Dept. of Agriculture and Ted Davis
results.brief_description: States in the north of Australia are the home of the Queensland Fruit Fly, the predator which each year can destroy million of dollars worth of fruit and vegetables. Shows the precautions which are taken to keep the fruit fly out of Victoria and the methods used to control it once it is discovered. Stresses the need for the co-operation of every traveller entering Victoria by land, sea or air. Photography by Ted Davis. Narrated by Terry McDermott.

results.title: Beyond the boom: metal mining in Australia
results.creator_credit: Lilias Fraser, Norman Castle, Australian Mining Industry Council and Fraser Castle Productions
results.brief_description: The evolution of mining in Australia from the first gold discoveries to the iron, nickel and copper developments of the 1960’s , its historic importance in national growth and economic stability and in the exploration and settling of much of Australia. The scope of modern mining and processing industries, exploration and prospecting, the growth of new towns and stimulation of regional development.

results.title: Beyond the blue meanies: the animation of Paul Driessen
results.brief_description: After working on the Beatles’ animated film “Yellow submarine” Paul Driessen immigrated to Canada and joined the National Film Board in 1972. The six films in this compilation showcase the whimsical and unique style of a renowned prize-winning animator. Contains: “Le Bleu perdu/The Lost blue” : Grey smog clouds the earth and a young boy dons a pair of wings to learn that there is a clear blue sky; “Air!”: Clean, fresh air is becoming scarce as plants, birds, fish and finally, people, come to the same “breathless” end; “Cat’s cradle”: A parable using the metaphor of the cat’s cradle shows that all our lives are interconnected; “An old box”: During Christmas a lonely homeless man finds a magical box that takes him on a fantastic spiritual journey; “The Same old story”: Life is stranger than fiction — a truism that comes alive in this deceptively simple film; “The End of the world in four seasons”: Eight stories unfold simultaneously on screen in this witty black comedy to the accompaniment of Vivaldi’s Four Seasons.

results.title: Beyond the Big Issue : Digital Storytelling project
results.brief_description: Nine of Melbourne’s homeless and disabled share the stories of their lives and talk about how The Big Issue has changed their circumstances. They also talk about their interests, friends, family, daily struggles and how working for the Big Issue has helped restore dignity to their lives.
